body_html: I'm experiencing a fairly large slowdown too (on Windows 7 and Python 3.6; CPU) with the release of TensorFlow 1.9 and 1.10. For example, in 1.8 and versions prior, each evaluation step for the CNN MNIST example model takes an average of 13 seconds while in 1.9 and 1.10, it trains for an average of 380 seconds. I hope this is still getting looked over.

body: I'm experiencing a fairly large slowdown too (on Windows 7 and Python 3.6; CPU) with the release of TensorFlow 1.9 and 1.10. For example, in 1.8 and versions prior, each evaluation step for the [CNN MNIST example model](https://www.tensorflow.org/tutorials/estimators/cnn) takes an average of 13 seconds while in 1.9 and 1.10, it trains for an average of 380 seconds. I hope this is still getting looked over.
